description: A long lived settlement extending from the Middle Iron Age to the 5th CE. Middle to Late Iron Age phase contains a square structure which is identified as a possible shrine. In the Roman period a Jupiter sculpture was discovered in an enclosure ditch which may be related to the shrine.
bibliography: Cambridge Archaeological Unit. “The Camp Ground Excavations. Colne Fen, Earith. Assessment Report.” Archaeology Data Service, 2004. https://doi.org/10.5284/1021819.
Evans, C. “Process and History: Romano-British Communities at Colne Fen, Earith. An Inland Port and Supply Farm.” Cambridge Archaeological Unit, 2012.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Camp Ground, Colne Fen, Earith (Cambridgeshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
